title: J. M. G. Le Clezio - French novelist (2 books)
description:
J. M. G. Le CLÃƒâ€°ZIO (b. 1940) is a French-Mauritian writer and professor.  Le ClÃƒÂ©zio was awarded the 2008 Nobel Prize in Literature as an "author of new departures, poetic adventure and sensual ecstasy, explorer of a humanity beyond and below the reigning civilization."  He has written over forty highly acclaimed books and has been translated into thirty-six languages.

THE INTERROGATION [Le ProcÃƒÂ¨s-Verbal], his first novel, won the Prix Renaudot in 1963.  London's Sunday Telegraph called it "a brilliant and fascinating literary debut, flecked throughout with an originality and a freshness of thought which stirs the imagination."

The Swedish Academy, in awarding the Nobel Prize, praised DESERT [DÃƒÂ©sert] as Le ClÃƒÂ©zio's "definitive breakthrough as a novelist."  Published in France in 1980, the book received the Grand Prix Paul Morand from the AcadÃƒÂ©mie FranÃƒÂ§aise.


Both the following are in EPUB format:

* DESERT (David R. Godine, 2009).  Translated by C. Dickson.

* THE INTERROGATION (Penguin, 2008).  Translated by Daphne Woodward.
